block.p: Diane April Davis, an editor at Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, was married yesterday to John Martin Otter IV, a reporter and columnist there. The Rev. Steven Jay Yagerman performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of St. Thomas in Amagansett, N.Y.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an assistant city editor of the newspaper's Queens edition in Kew Gardens. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University. She is a daughter of Janet Althouse and Lee Davis, both of York, Pa. Her father retired as a guidance counselor at Eastern York High School in Wrightsville, Pa. Her mother teaches language arts at Eastern York Middle School.

Diane April Davis, an editor at Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, was married yesterday to John Martin Otter IV, a reporter and columnist there. The Rev. Steven Jay Yagerman performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of St. Thomas in Amagansett, N.Y.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an assistant city editor of the newspaper's Queens edition in Kew Gardens. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University. She is a daughter of Janet Althouse and Lee Davis, both of York, Pa. Her father retired as a guidance counselor at Eastern York High School in Wrightsville, Pa. Her mother teaches language arts at Eastern York Middle School.

The bridegroom, 34, writes Inside Stories, a weekly column about business, at the paper's main office, in Melville, N.Y. He graduated from Middlebury College. He is a son of Susan Otter and Mr. Otter III of Savannah, Ga. His father, who retired as an advertising consultant, is a former senior vice president of McCann-Erickson Worldwide, the advertising agency, in New York.
